New Records: Orlando Arcia hit two home runs, including a back-to-back with Sean Murphy, in the Braves' 7-2 win over the Phillies.
Key Match Events: Orlando Arcia went back-to-back with Sean Murphy off Ranger Suárez in the third inning
Arcia fueled a two-run sixth by taking Max Lazar deep
Pre-Game Insights: The Braves have won 13 of 18 since blowing an 8-2 eighth-inning lead against the Rockies at Coors Field on Aug. 11.
They also have won eight of 11 since learning on Aug. 19 that Austin Riley will miss the remainder of the regular season with a broken hand.
Post-Match Reflections: Braves manager Brian Snitker said, “These guys are fighting their rears off, man. We’re kind of in a day-to-day mode where we have to win every day, regardless of the series. We need every win we can get.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Braves have a three-game lead in the battle for the NL’s final Wild Card spot.
Braves starting pitchers haven’t allowed more than three runs in 19 straight games.
Others: Orlando Arcia playfully mimicked Bryce Harper’s stare after homering in Atlanta’s loss on Aug. 21.
The Phillies fans booed Arcia during pregame introductions and after both of his home runs.
